intro: Trigonocapnos, commonly known as the mountain bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Boraginaceae. It consists of several species, most notably Trigonocapnos caerulea, which is native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. The plants are characterized by their showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to violet. They typically grow in alpine or rocky habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Trigonocapnos species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to flourish in challenging environments.
